title: How to Unlock an LG Phone If You Forgot the Password

steps.title: Turn off the phone.
steps.content: Turn off the phone. Press and hold the Power button on the right side of the phone to open a menu. Then tap power off, then tap OK . If you have Android 4.4 or lower, you can use your Google account to get back into your phone . [1] X Research source Resetting everything back to factory settings is the only way you can get back into your locked Android. However, here are alternatives to getting locked out, like using a PIN, pattern, fingerprint, or Face ID lock.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button and Volume Down button.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button and Volume Down button. When the phone is off, press and hold the Power and Volume Down buttons together until you see the LG logo appear. The Volume Down button is on the left-hand side of the phone.

steps.title: Release the keys when you see the LG logo.
steps.content: Release the keys when you see the LG logo. When the LG logo appears, release the keys.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button again.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button again. As soon as you let go of the Power and Volume Down buttons when the LG logo appears, immediately press the power button once again until the Factory Reset screen appears.

steps.title: Release the Power button.
steps.content: Release the Power button. When the Factory Reset screen appears, release the Power Button.

steps.title: Press the Power button to continue.
steps.content: Press the Power button to continue. The Power button will continue with the Factory Reset process. Press the Volume Up or Down buttons to cancel. A factory reset will allow you to access your phone again, but it will also delete all the data on it. This includes photos, movies, music, apps, data, browser tabs, browser history, app data, videos, contacts, and anything thatâ€™s not backed up. You should routinely back up the data on your phone so you don't lose too much by resetting.

steps.title: Press the Power button again.
steps.content: Press the Power button again. This will confirm that you wish to factory reset your phone. Press Volume Up or Volume Down to cancel the factory reset process. [2] X Research source Doing this will allow you to use your phone again!

steps.title: Dial *#06# in the phone app.
steps.content: Dial *#06# in the phone app. You can usually find the app in the lower left corner of the bottom row of apps on your screen. Go to the "keypad" to dial this number, which most likely isn't in your contacts. This will display the 15-digit IMEI number. Write this number down. You will need it when you contact customer service. Alternatively, you can get this number by going to Settings > General > About Phone > Status . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Contact your service provider.
steps.content: Contact your service provider. You will need to contact the original service provider that provides the service on your phone. Tell them you either plan on selling the phone or traveling abroad. Be prepared to give them your name, phone number, email, and the IMEI number. They will send you an email with an unlock code and some instructions. Follow the instructions carefully. The code will only work once. Your service provider will generally provide you with an unlock code free of charge. However, some service providers have certain requirements that you must meet before they provide you with an unlock code. Your service provider may refuse to provide you with an unlock code.

steps.title: Check your email.
steps.content: Check your email. It may take up to three business days for an email with the unlock code to be sent to you. Follow the email instructions carefully. The unlock code will only work once.

steps.title: Power off your phone.
steps.content: Power off your phone. You should always turn off your phone before removing the SIM.

steps.title: Replace the SIM.
steps.content: Replace the SIM. Remove the old SIM from your phone and replace it with the new SIM. Consult the user manual to see where the SIM is on your phone model.

steps.title: Power your phone back on.
steps.content: Power your phone back on. With the new SIM card in place, you can now power your phone back on.

steps.title: Enter the unlock code.
steps.content: Enter the unlock code. Once the unlock code is accepted, you can use your phone abroad with any carrier or SIM. You generally cannot use the carrier to unlock an LG cell phone if you have disconnected the service. In this case, reconnect for a few days, and then you can call them to unlock the phone.

steps.title: Get a third-party service to unlock your phone.
steps.content: Get a third-party service to unlock your phone. There are plenty of options available online that claim to unlock your phone from your carrier. Note that most carriers provide this service for free (either immediately after you purchase or after a few days of actively using the network), so paying for this doesn't always make sense. Giving money and your phone data to a third-party service breaches your security and makes you more vulnerable to malicious actors. Third-party services offer to unlock your cell phone from a cellular carrier as well as unlock a phone when you've forgotten the password without factory resetting. With newer versions of Android, you cannot unlock your phone if you forgot the password without resetting it to factory settings. Don't believe third-party services that claim otherwise.

steps.title: Try a PIN, Pattern, Fingerprint, or Face ID.
steps.content: Try a PIN, Pattern, Fingerprint, or Face ID. These are the default security measures on your phone. Switching to a biometric like your fingerprint or Face ID ensures you'll be able to unlock your LG phone even if you don't remember the password. If you have multiple security measures set up in advance, you can use any of them to unlock your Android to avoid getting locked out of your phone. For example, if you have Face ID set up but there isn't enough light for your camera to read your face, you can also enter your PIN or swipe a pattern instead. Having multiple security measures in place will help you get back into your locked Android should you not be able to unlock it. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Use Extend Unlock with a Trusted Device.
steps.content: Use Extend Unlock with a Trusted Device. Newer phones (mostly Android 10+) have a feature called Extend Unlock, previously called Smart Lock. Being near a trusted device (like a computer) or within a GPS area will cause the phone to unlock without you needing to input a password. [5] X Research source To set it up and use it, go to Settings > Lock screen > Extend Unlock/Settings > Privacy & security > Extend Unlock , and choose the right settings for you.
